name: GetAllMarketingCampaigns
description:
Fetches all marketing campaigns from an account.

Use this tool to retrieve a list of all marketing campaigns associated with a Mailchimp account.

parameters.name: fields_to_return
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of fields to return. Use dot notation for sub-object parameters.

value_schema.description: A comma-separated list of fields to return. Reference parameters of sub-objects with dot notation.

parameters.name: exclude_fields
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of fields to exclude from the response. Use dot notation for sub-object parameters.

value_schema.description: A comma-separated list of fields to exclude. Reference parameters of sub-objects with dot notation.

parameters.name: number_of_records_to_return
parameters.description: Number of records to return, between 10 and 1000. Default is 10.

value_schema.description: The number of records to return. Default value is 10. Maximum value is 1000

parameters.name: pagination_offset
parameters.description: The number of records to skip for pagination. Default is 0.

value_schema.description: Used for [pagination](https://mailchimp.com/developer/marketing/docs/methods-parameters/#pagination), this is the number of records from a collection to skip. Default value is 0.

parameters.name: campaign_type
parameters.description: Specify the type of campaign to retrieve (e.g., regular, plaintext, absplit).

value_schema.description: The campaign type.

parameters.name: campaign_status
parameters.description: Filter campaigns by their status (e.g., sent, draft).

value_schema.description: The status of the campaign.

parameters.name: sent_before_time
parameters.description: Restricts the response to campaigns sent before the specified time. It should be in ISO 8601 format.

value_schema.description: Restrict the response to campaigns sent before the set time. Uses ISO 8601 time format: 2015-10-21T15:41:36+00:00.

parameters.name: restrict_to_campaigns_sent_after
parameters.description: Restrict the response to campaigns sent after the specified ISO 8601 time.

value_schema.description: Restrict the response to campaigns sent after the set time. Uses ISO 8601 time format: 2015-10-21T15:41:36+00:00.

parameters.name: created_before_date_time
parameters.description: Restrict response to campaigns created before this time using ISO 8601 format.

value_schema.description: Restrict the response to campaigns created before the set time. Uses ISO 8601 time format: 2015-10-21T15:41:36+00:00.

parameters.name: campaigns_created_after
parameters.description: Specify the date and time to restrict results to campaigns created after this point. Must be in ISO 8601 format.

value_schema.description: Restrict the response to campaigns created after the set time. Uses ISO 8601 time format: 2015-10-21T15:41:36+00:00.

parameters.name: list_unique_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the list associated with the campaigns to be retrieved.

value_schema.description: The unique id for the list.

parameters.name: unique_folder_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the folder containing the campaigns.

value_schema.description: The unique folder id.

parameters.name: list_member_identifier
parameters.description: The MD5 hash of the lowercase version of the list member’s email. Used to retrieve campaigns sent to this member.

value_schema.description: Retrieve campaigns sent to a particular list member. Member ID is The MD5 hash of the lowercase version of the list member’s email address.

parameters.name: sort_by_field
parameters.description: Specify the field to sort the campaigns by. Use dot notation for sub-object fields.

value_schema.description: Returns files sorted by the specified field.

parameters.name: sort_order_direction
parameters.description: Specify the sorting order for the results. Use 'ASC' for ascending or 'DESC' for descending.

value_schema.description: Determines the order direction for sorted results.

parameters.name: include_resend_shortcut_eligibility
parameters.description: Include this field in the response to determine if campaigns are eligible for Resend Shortcuts.

value_schema.description: Return the `resend_shortcut_eligibility` field in the response, which tells you if the campaign is eligible for the various Campaign Resend Shortcuts offered.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the Mailchimp Marketing API.
